title: Trump Escalates Tensions With European Allies With Greenland and Gaza Efforts
summary: President Trump’s bellicose demands about Greenland and participation in his “board of peace” are deepening worries about the fate of the trans-Atlantic alliance.

title: Stocks Post Biggest Drop in Months as Tensions Over Greenland Mount
summary: The S&P 500 dropped over 2 percent on Tuesday, its biggest decline since October.

title: Some Republicans Begin to Echo Trump’s Case to Acquire Greenland
summary: While the party remains split as President Trump presses to “take” Greenland, some in his party are publicly embracing his reasoning for wanting to control the territory.

title: C.I.A.’s New Focus on Latin America Reflected in Raid to Seize Maduro
summary: A senior U.S. official declined to confirm the specific operations in Venezuela, but said a covert team provided real-time support for the military.

title: Comer Rejects Clinton Interview on Epstein, Setting Up Contempt Vote
summary: The Republican chairman of the Oversight Committee refused an offer to interview the former president under oath, rejecting terms he said were unreasonable.

title: University of Pennsylvania Rebukes Trump Administration for Demanding Information About Jewish Staff
summary: The federal government has sued the University of Pennsylvania for information on its Jewish employees. The university said the request recalls a “frightening” history.

title: California Republicans Ask Supreme Court to Block New Congressional Map
summary: Republicans asked the justices to step in after a federal court rejected their claims that the state’s new congressional map violated the Constitution.

title: Trump’s First Year Could Have Lasting Economic Consequences
summary: President Trump’s policies have so far done little to change the overall state of the American economy, but economists warn they will ultimately weaken the United States.

title: One Year In, Searching for a Strategy Behind Trump’s Unpredictability
summary: One great truth of Trump II so far is that nobody has any idea what tomorrow holds.

title: Scientists Set Up Camp on Thwaites Glacier in Antarctica
summary: Low clouds have lifted long enough for helicopters to ferry scientists and their gear to a fast-melting glacier on the edge of Antarctica.

title: Despite Drastic Financial Steps, Met Opera Turns to Layoffs and Cuts
summary: The largest performing arts organization in the country will lay off workers, cut salaries and reduce its offerings. It may also sell its Chagall murals that are valued at $55 million.

title: Photographer Discovers Train Part That Could Hold Key to Spain Train Crash
summary: Officials said they had located a previously unreported train undercarriage near the site of a deadly train crash in Spain. Experts said the finding could help investigators.

title: Another Train Crash in Spain Kills 1 and Hurts 37, Officials Say
summary: Train service in the Catalonia region will be suspended until it is safe to resume rail traffic, the local operator said.

title: Mississippi Temple Says There Is More to Its Story Than Facing Hate
summary: An arson attack at a synagogue in Mississippi was a reminder of the threat Jews face, but also of the strength of a small community forged over generations.

title: Prosecutors Subpoena Minnesota Democrats as Part of Federal Inquiry
summary: The move is a significant expansion of the Justice Department’s investigation into the state’s leaders, including Gov. Tim Walz and Mayor Jacob Frey of Minneapolis.

title: Minnesota Police Leaders Criticize Federal Tactics in ICE Surge
summary: Gregory Bovino, a senior Border Patrol official, said agents were operating lawfully and were “focused on individuals who pose a serious threat to this community.”

title: We’re Still Talking About Bernie Goetz After All These Years
summary: Two new books return to the ’80s-era saga of Bernie Goetz to consider the 21st-century intersections of race, crime and sensationalism.

title: Valentino Defined the Way ‘Rich’ Once Looked
summary: The death of the designer Valentino marks the end of an era, not just in fashion but in dressing the part.

title: With Greenland, Trumpism Is Doomed Without Restraint
summary: The president needs counterforces to save him from himself.

title: Trump Mocks European Leaders Before Meeting With Them
summary: Also, fewer people are jumping off the Golden Gate Bridge. Here’s the latest at the end of Tuesday.

title: Tips for Cooking With New Scaled Recipes on NYT Cooking
summary: NYT Cooking’s new automatic feature can instantly scale a recipe up or down — follow these tips (and your instincts) to make the most of it.

title: Los Angeles School Desegregation Policy Hurts White Students, Lawsuit Says
summary: Schools with more white children miss out on smaller class sizes and other benefits, the lawsuit says. The policy dates back to desegregation efforts in the 1970s.

title: Forecasters Warn of a Major Storm Brewing for the South
summary: One meteorologist warns that “the main ingredients” are fitting into place for a disruptive winter storm later this week.

title: On Day 1, Mikie Sherrill Focuses on Utility Costs and Children’s Safety
summary: The new governor of New Jersey signed six executive orders after taking office on Tuesday. They matched the priorities she campaigned on last year.
